intro: Scirpidium piauhiense, commonly known as the Piauhi fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that emerge from a short, creeping rhizome. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sporangia, are located on the underside of its leaves. Due to habitat loss, Scirpidium piauhiense is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
